learn.definition: Conflict is professional friction over competing project priorities, not personal 'fighting'.
learn.context: Highest during 'Storming' phase. PMs must transition the team to 'Norming'.
learn.path: Prioritize Collaboration (Win-Win). Move to Compromise only if time is a critical constraint.
learn.boundary: Handle disputes internally. Avoid escalating peer-to-peer technical issues to the Sponsor.

practice.mindset: Collaborate before you escalate. Conflict is a resource.
practice.enablers: Analyze Source & Stage // Determine Context // Recommend Resolution
practice.traps: NEVER escalate to a sponsor. AVOID 'Smoothing' traps for long-term issues.
practice.artifacts: Thomas-Kilmann Model // Team Charter // Active Listening

learn.definition: The art of inspiring a team to meet project objectives through a shared vision.
learn.context: Requires shifting styles (Servant, Situational, Transformational) based on team maturity.
learn.path: Prioritize Servant Leadership. Your job is to remove obstacles so the team can perform.
learn.boundary: Leadership is about people and culture; management is about tasks and control.

practice.mindset: Empower the team; don't micromanage. Trust is your primary currency.
practice.enablers: Set Vision // Support Diversity // Inspire Performance
practice.traps: Avoid 'Command and Control' distractors. Never bypass team members for their managers.
practice.artifacts: Team Charter // RACI Matrix // Resource Management Plan

learn.definition: Evaluating team member performance and providing feedback to optimize outcomes.
learn.context: Performance is measured against the Project Management Plan and Team Charter.
learn.path: Feedback should be constructive, timely, and focused on growth.
learn.boundary: Individual performance issues are handled privately; team successes are celebrated publicly.

practice.mindset: Performance is a continuous improvement loop, not a once-a-year event.
practice.enablers: Appraise Performance // Verify Competencies // Reward Achievement
practice.traps: Never delay performance feedback until the end of the project.
practice.artifacts: Performance Appraisals // Training Records // Recognition Plan

learn.definition: Granting teams authority and resources to make decisions and take ownership.
learn.context: Critical for Agile environments where self-organizing teams are required.
learn.path: Shift from 'Boss' to 'Facilitator.' Delegating authority increases speed and morale.
learn.boundary: Empowerment requires clear 'Guardrails' defined in the Team Charter.

practice.mindset: Ownership drives results. The team should be autonomous within their scope.
practice.enablers: Delegate Authority // Support Self-Organization // Foster Accountability
practice.traps: Do not take back delegated tasks the moment a mistake is made.
practice.artifacts: Delegation Log // Skills Matrix // Agile Manifesto

learn.definition: Identifying skill gaps and providing resources for team development.
learn.context: Training needs change as the project moves through its lifecycle.
learn.path: Invest in training early to prevent quality issues and delays.

practice.mindset: A highly trained team reduces the need for heavy project oversight.
practice.enablers: Identify Gaps // Allocate Training Budget // Measure Efficacy
practice.traps: Do not assume a lack of performance is always a lack of training; check resources.
practice.artifacts: Skills Gap Analysis // Resource Management Plan // Training Logs

learn.definition: Bringing the right people together and fostering a cohesive group dynamic.
learn.context: Requires understanding team chemistry and technical requirements.
learn.path: Use Tuckman's stages to guide the team from Forming to Performing.
learn.boundary: Building a team is a continuous process, not just a kick-off meeting task.

practice.mindset: The whole is greater than the sum of its parts.
practice.enablers: Define Roles // Hire/Acquire Resources // Build Culture
practice.traps: Avoid hiring only 'experts' if they cannot collaborate together.
practice.artifacts: Project Staffing // Responsibility Assignment Matrix (RAM) // Team Charter

learn.definition: Identifying and clearing obstacles that prevent the team from completing their work.
learn.context: A core responsibility of the Servant Leader (Scrum Master or PM).
learn.path: Maintain an Impediment Log and prioritize obstacles based on their impact on the Critical Path.
learn.boundary: PMs remove 'blockers'; teams solve 'technical problems.' Don't do the team's job for them.

practice.mindset: Your value is measured by how smooth you make the path for your team.
practice.enablers: Identify Blockers // Prioritize Resolution // Shield Team from Interruptions
practice.traps: Avoid the trap of 'ignoring' small blockers; they aggregate into project delays.
practice.artifacts: Impediment Log // Daily Stand-up Notes // Kanban Board

learn.definition: Reaching a formal consensus on project scope, budget, and resources with stakeholders.
learn.context: Negotiation is constantâ€”from procuring vendors to assigning internal team members.
learn.path: Aim for 'Win-Win' outcomes. Focus on interests, not positions.
learn.boundary: A PM negotiates for the project's health, not for personal or departmental victory.

practice.mindset: Fairness and sustainability are more important than 'winning' a single debate.
practice.enablers: Determine Strategy // Facilitate Dialogue // Finalize Contract
practice.traps: Never negotiate without a clear 'Best Alternative to a Negotiated Agreement' (BATNA).
practice.artifacts: Procurement SOW // Service Level Agreements (SLAs) // Resource Calendar

learn.definition: Building strong working relationships to align stakeholder expectations with project goals.
learn.context: Stakeholders aren't just 'customers'; they are anyone affected by the project.
learn.path: Engagement is proactive. Use a Power/Interest grid to tailor your communication.
learn.boundary: Engagement is not just 'reporting'; it is active participation and feedback.

practice.mindset: A stakeholder ignored is a stakeholder who will eventually block you.
practice.enablers: Map Stakeholders // Align Interests // Manage Expectations
practice.traps: Avoid the 'Inform only' trap. Proactively seek collaboration from high-power stakeholders.
practice.artifacts: Stakeholder Register // Power-Interest Grid // Stakeholder Engagement Plan
